column2: Every capable, able-bodied man and all the resources of the state are being put towards our national struggle and our eventual victory

Due to their post in far-flung Beornia and the farthest reaches of the Qullasuyu, our soldiers and generals are suffering the effects of the 'Muru Unquy' - The disease of the spots, better known as Smallpox.
Besieged by the ravenous hordes of the Andes, every economic resource is being used, and every able-bodied man is being drafted to the frontlines. We will prevail!
There is currently a set of trials to purge both collaborators of the previous regime and any other radical elements in the country
''It is better to abolish serfdom from above than to wait for it to abolish itself from below.'' \n -Alexander II of Russia

Serfs who occupied a plot of land were required to work for the Lord of the Manor who owned that land, and in return were entitled to protection, justice and the right to exploit certain fields within the manor to maintain their own subsistence. However, as we move further into modernity there is no need for this relic of feudalism any longer.

With enough geopolitical clout we can officially declare the end of colonialism and the start of a new age of international self-determination. §RTHIS WILL LIKELY CAUSE THE NEARLY IMMEDIATE END OF PRACTICALLY ALL COLONIAL EMPIRES.§W
This country is a native Amerigan state and does not have the same ability to assimilate its population as the post-colonial states.

The German Revolution was a event that took place in Frankfurt in the late 18th Century, representing the culmination of liberal thought which had built up across Europe in the preceding century. This Revolution - often simply referred to by Europeans as "the Revolution" - was utterly crushed after several catastrophic failures from its leadership. Furthermore, its practical aim (German unification) was appropriated by the Holy Roman Emperor, who sought to pursue such a goal without alterations to the social order. Thus liberalism and absolutism still contend on the battlefield of ideas on equal terms, with neither concept seen as supreme - and unless a second Revolution shakes a world power, liberalism may never reach its full potential.

As the dust from the liberal revolutions of the 1840s settles and the liberal utopia that many had expected in Europe had not arisen, the movement has begun to split into both Commercialist and Radicalist ideologies. Commercialists see the failures of liberalism as an overriding attachment to social and political issues while failing to understand the role of economics in shaping, rather than being shaped by, society. They uphold freedom of commerce as a good in and of itself, and maintain a strong ethos of individualism. Radicalists in contrast see liberalism's failure as a consequence of abandoning the Dahlkist commitment to total social equality, equity, and justice. Therefore they pursue both peaceful and armed struggle towards a free, united, democratic, and secular society. These splits have dealt severe harm to the unity of the liberal cause.

The Burgundian crisis of the mid-19th century and its aftermath echoed across Europe and the world. The clash of the Royalists and the Parliamentarians sharped political debates around monarchism, the rights of the people, and the nature of the 'state' in both legal and philosophical terms. In the wake of the crisis, some saw it as evidence that monarchy must inevitably give way to democracy, lest it become mere tyranny. Others instead saw proof that monarchism, properly supported by a broad political movement, was quite capable of survival even in the modern era. The violence which played out during the crisis also informed future military tactics about warfare conducted in urban and semi-urban environments.

The fervor of radical ideologies coming to the fore in Germany has opened the floodgates of worldwide political upheaval. With both the far left and the far right taking on wild new shapes, the old "liberal-conservative" axis of the post-Dahlke era is seen as an anachronism. The new century brings with it hitherto unseen paradigms of social organization and activity, fueled either by utopian dreams of the future or desires to revive the distant past in the context of the present. Most striking of all is the embrace of revolutionary rhetoric by both extreme ends of the political spectrum, shattering one of the greatest iron laws of European-inspired politics : the right wing's abhorrence of the Revolution and its loyalty to the Altes Regimes.

A Great Empire has risen somewhere in the world, built by the efforts of its people to rule the world as we know it. This nation, unlike all those which have preceeded it, is without obvious peer or equal. Not simply through sheer territorial size but in all-pervading economic presence has this Empire become the arbiter of world affairs. Now is the age of humanity's first true superpower, whose legacy - especially in terms of culture and language - will shape the rest of the world long after its future decline and fall.

The German Order is completely shattered and changed in ways that are unreconizable. The Holy Roman Empire's principle of Ewiger Landfriede (Eternal Public Peace), intended to prevent internal wars between Imperial Estates, collapsed during the escalating strife and chaos of the 1840s. This opened the door to radical shifts in the German political landscape, as German nationalism, thought banished after the end of the Great German War in 1820, returned with a terrible vengeance. This, combined with the devastation of the Hollowing, has upended the political balance of central Europe. More impotantly, liberalism and absolutism have once again faced each other on the German battlefield, and their confrontation will echo far beyond the continent.

In the wake of the Great German War, European conservatism found itself struggling to escape its ties to the Altes Regime - to the world of crown, church, and country, to high-handed aristocracy. This was compounded by Cornelius Blanqui's publication of The Communist Manifesto, in which Blanqui argued that the class interests of European society were inherently opposed and called upon the working class to overthrow its oppressors. Facing the desertion of the lower classes towards liberalism and socialism, conservatism was forced to reconcile itself with modern methods of mass organizing.  Paternalism thus arose as an answer to the attacks of liberalism and socialism - a way to appropriate socialist policies of welfare and liberal notions of broad political involvement, and orient them towards the support and protection of the elites. Yet just as the "old money" of the aristocracy leaned on Paternalism to redirect the energy of the masses, they found themselves forced to make common cause with the "new money" of the bourgeoisie - who increasingly became the senior partner of such conservative alliances.

With the First Internationale and the further strengthening of Commercialist movements internationally, the values of the original enlightenment have been seemingly left in darkness and replaced by that of the worker and the capitalist.

The failure for Socialist Parties to be elected in the notoriously reactionary Europe has led many into believing that only violent methods will result in them taking the reigns of power with ideals similar to their more extremist Communist counterparts.

With the downfall of Aragon as a Great Power we have gained a very good possibility to fill the power vacuum in Italy through helping the Grand Duchy of Savoy to gain the Iron Crown.

The Incan Empire had never been fully conquered by Spanish Conquistadors and that has allowed it to spread its influence like a petulant disease across the whole of Western Ameriga. We should embark on the mission to clear out the great error that the Spanish Empire made and remove the Incan Empire from history!
Etruria is the sole survivor of the Great German War and is persistently sought out by political refugees throughout Europe

The Bavarian Constitution as written during the Liberal Revolutions of the mid 19th Century was notably Liberal in comparison to most other efforts in Europe during this period. It is said that this constitution was authored by survivors from the Great German Wars whom saw a chance to influence policy in this normally conservative kingdom in the centre of Europe. Of course, most agree that none of the great powers in the region particularly liked the idea of Bavaria going down the path of liberalism but nobody would attempt to directly intervene or potentially risk yet another Great German War.

The conclusion of the Hindustan Conference has completely opened the riches of India to European colonization. Anyone whom owns territory in India must put all efforts into colonizing India regardless of the costs to themselves, because the alternative is to lose out on great wealth for all!

Be warned that this may make the rebels too weak in the late game and will not retroactively remove rebel equipment that has already been granted up to the date when this decision was pressed!

If you dislike the idea of your army deciding to randomly fight itself then this decision should make it impossible for Soldiers to ever take part in a Munity or Uprising of any type. Be aware that you can still have Munities in Conscripted Pops as they are not Soldiers.

With our economy proven to be somewhat viable and with many foreign connections throughout our military leadership. It should be possible to purchase foreign weapons directly and bypass the need for any home-grown attempt at replicating foreign arms.

The fact that the Torgai Khanate has continued to exist as long it has without annexation by any Russian state is a miracle in its own right. Since we effectively control their government it would be well advised to directly integrate it into the growing motherland as soon as we can.

The Kingdom of Transleithania has defeated all its enemies, maintained its territorial stability and has effectively become the new defender of the Balkans. This has unsurprisingly upset the balance of power in Europe. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporally and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

The Franconian Circle of the Holy Roman Empire should be considered the core territory of $COUNTRY$ but currently due to ancient feudal laws $COUNTRY$ does not presently claim this territory. However, if $COUNTRY$ were to rise above its station as a minor state then it may be possible to claim the whole circle.

With the complete failure of any Italian power to successfully secure the extremely valuable Niger Delta through the former colonies of Genoa- $COUNTRY$ must endeavour to annex the Niger Delta for its own colonial plans. WARNING: This may start a war with the owner of the state.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to us seeking the annexation of the Niger Delta into their ever expanding colonial empire. Refusal will give a justification for them to annex us in our entirety for as they put it: "destabilizing the region".
We have no choice. Give them the land.
Fight back against the imperialist menace!

Despite the efforts of the French and English to end the Dual Monarchy, $CAPITAL$ has restored its control through sheer military determination. It seems clear that Paris’s idea of trying to promote the Anglois idea peacefully was a fool’s errand and that the only thing that matters is the use of force. If that is what the people want then that is what they shall get and any threat to the Anglois idea shall be purged. Those who say “Vive la France” shall perish and those who fight only for England's green and pleasant land will burn. All those who work against $CAPITAL$ shall be punished no stone shall be left unturned, and the rot shall not fester. It doesn’t matter how long it takes or what it shall take the ends will justify the means.
We tried the carrot, now we use the stick.

Due to the previous democratic government’s failure to peacefully present the Anglois idea to the people and the resulting devastating revolution, the monarch has lost trust in not only the government, but democracy as a whole. With the use of the armed forces the Estates-General has been dissolved and a new government has been formed called the Gouvernement de Salut National or Government of National Salvation. This government answers only to the ruler of the Dual-Monarchy and they have one mandate, to ensure Anglois supremacy in the country. To this end they have been given a blank cheque to do whatever is necessary to bring forth a new cultural revolution and create a god-fearing people who are loyal to the fatherland.

In order to protect the Anglois Idea extreme measures have to be taken. Agents have been sent throughout the country to find those spreading dissent and making sure that those voices are silenced. Their work shall be quick and brutal, and those that witness the aftermath will only be able to respond with “l'Horreur, l'Horreur!”

In the aftermath of the Franco-English Revolution the government has launched a reign of terror against all those who were against the central government under the name of retribution. This has targeted not only the former government officials, but anyone who has a connection to someone who was a part of the Revolution. This has created a state of paranoia as citizens sell out other citizens to authorities in the hopes that they will be spared. Many have fled the country and many have perished, and all anyone has to say to this is “I guess they were hiding something”

Now that we have taken possession of this African colony, we should reorganize its structure to make it truly part of our greater colonial administration.

There are today many Communists in this country. They are everywhere -- in factories, offices, butcher stores, on street corners, in private businesses. And each carries in himself the germ of death for society. - The Communists are starting to become dangerously strong in our nation and there must be a systematic campaign to root them out and destroy them before they can topple our government and replace it with their Communistic dictatorship.
We have recently conducted a campaign against the red menace in our country. We will need time to regroup if we want to launch another campaign against them.

“The strategic adversary is fascism... the fascism in us all, in our heads and in our everyday behaviour, the fascism that causes us to love power, to desire the very thing that dominates and exploits us.” - The Fascists are starting to become dangerously strong in our nation and there must be a systematic campaign to root them out and destroy them before they can topple our government and replace it with their Fascistic dictatorship.
We have recently conducted a campaign against Fascism in our country. We will need time to regroup if we want to launch another campaign against them.

“...new evils require new remedies … new sanctions to defend and vindicate the eternal principles of right and wrong”. - We have been burdened with the task of removing the supporters of the previous regime to give justice to the many lives that they had sent to ruin and to ensure that they cannot rise against our regime again.
