The Germans in the west have achieved a foothold near Danzig and would be ready to challenge any of our moves against the Danzigers and the Prussians. Dealing with this issue will require some maneuvering...
Our Baltic ambitions will be realized!

We have repulsed Scandinavia’s encroachment on our German kin in Danzig and Prussia! Now with our protection, Danzig’s assembly has confirmed and approved its ascension into $COUNTRY$. In addition to Danzig, Prussia remains open to us, and with Danzig in our hands we may send the Baltic state an offer to join our nation with ease. It’s a glorious day to all Germans east and west of the Weichsel river!

We have sidelined the Germans' attempt to covet Danzig! Scandinavia's position in Danzig and Prussia has been solidified, and our position as the protector of the small Baltic states is indisputable. Now without Polish and German involvement, we may annex the coast and realize our dream of Scandinavian hegemony over the Baltic sea. Of course, Prussia might prove to be more hesitant to annexation than Danzig, but with the Germans out of the picture, we don’t have to worry.

Our effort to secure the Baltic coast has been thwarted by $FROMCOUNTRY$, who has entered Danzig with its forces, and officially annexed the city with the blessing of Danzig’s assembly. Word has spread that $FROMCOUNTRY$ even plans on marching to Prussia! We can only gaze at our neighbours across the Baltic sea with anger, as they take what should have been rightfully ours.

Scandinavia’s imperial ambitions in the Baltic sea have been furthered, as Scandinavia entered the city of Danzig and officially annexed it with the blessing of the city’s assembly. In addition, Scandinavia is now free to further its aggressive actions into Prussia! With this move, Scandinavia has strengthened its position in the Baltic sea and denied our brethren their right to be governed by their own! It’s a sad day for our countrymen...

We need subtly if we want to deal with Danzig and Prussia, making outright aggressive moves might draw the ire of the Germans to the west. Some of our officials suggest dispatching a proposal to the city, and offering it our protection as a replacement of Poland’s. Danzig holds no particular loyalty towards the crown of Poland and may agree to our demands. But regardless of our request, it is safe to expect a German reaction to any dialogue between Danzig and our nation.

As Poland collapsed, our status in the region has been shaken to its core. We lived for centuries under Polish autonomy as a center of trade and German culture. But now in the chaos of the present, Scandinavia has come bearing an offer of “protection”. Scandinavia proposes to protect and aid the city from foreign threats, stressing our shared heritage in the Baltic sea as the basis. Most of Danzig’s assembly is distraught, as the proposal reeks of territorial ambition and the expansion of its empire as it has done in the rest of the baltic coast. Most in our city express more sympathy towards the Germans in the west, identifying with them as an ethnic kin in comparison to the Nordic Scandinavians, and many wish to petition Germany for protection instead. But some in our assembly are friendly to Scandinavia, expressing optimism about the economy of our city should it be integrated into Scandinavia.

As Poland collapsed, Danzig’s status in the region has been shaken to its core. The city has existed as an autonomy of Poland for centuries and flourished as a center of trade and German culture. But now in the chaos of the present, Scandinavia has begun a campaign of aggressive expansion in the region. Scandinavia proposes to protect and aid Danzig from foreign threats, naturally a blatant excuse to occupy and annex the defenseless city. Danizg is rightfully fearful, and has called on us to protect and defend them from Scandinavia.

To our dismay $FROMCOUNTRY$ has declared its intention to defend Danzig against us! Danzig has decided to outright reject our proposal and call on $FROMCOUNTRY$ for help. The Riksdag is furious and our generals call for action against this blatant spit in the face of Scandinavian prestige. We are not sure how committed $FROMCOUNTRY$ is to defending little Danzig from us, but our diplomats suggest ignoring $FROMCOUNTRY$’s announcement and deploying a marine detachment to “protect” the city before $FROMCOUNTRY$ sends its forces to secure it completely.

Scandinavia has ignored our declaration of protection, and went so far as deploying a marine detachment to occupy the city! Danzig will not be able to stop the marines from seizing the city, ignoring this threat will surely mean that Danzig, if not the whole of Prussia will fall under Scandinavian control! Our military staff implore us to send our cavalry to the city as quickly as possible to intercept this threat and secure Danzig.

Our biggest fear has come true, our marines were intercepted by cavalry from $FROMCOUNTRY$ in an attempt to stop our advance on the city. Our brave marines have set camp on shore now, and are preparing for a final assault on the city. The situation is tense, as our marines appear to be superior in combat ability, while $FROMCOUNTRY$’s cavalry has the advantage of controlling the battlefield and maneuverability. This could go either way...

The identity of what it means to be a Lithuanian has increasingly become contested among our people. Now this battle of words has been carried into the university of Vilnius, where the new Lithuanian movement argues for the representation of the Baltic Lithuanian people against the Litvin and Polish nobility, and the spread of the Lithuanian language in the Grand Duchy’s institutions. The Baltic Lithuanian movement has begun circulating nationalist material, promoting the Lithuanian language and rejecting the Litvin claim of the Grand Duchy. Tensions between the groups are reaching their breaking point in the university...

Following the boom in Baltic Lithuanian literature in the University of Vilnius, the Litvin establishment has begun banning various pieces of Lithuanian literature involving the Lithuanian language and promotion of a new Baltic Lithuanian identity. This action has naturally caused outrage within the Lithuanians in Vilnius, and triggered a series of protests and threats of violence throughout the city.
The University of Vilnius bans Lithuanian literature

Unrest has recently surged throughout Vilnius, as middle class Baltic Lithuanians have begun to espouse their will for true Lithuanian representation in the Grand Duchy and the University of Vilnius. This movement was met with opposition from the traditional Ruthenian Litvins, who view themselves as the true and legitimate Lithuanian ideal. As a result, Baltic Lithuanian material in the University has been banned by its Litvin administration as an attempt to curb this movement. However, only time could tell if this move had a desirable effect.

Unrest in the Grand Duchy of Lithuania grows as the Baltic Lithuanian movement reaches new heights. Liberal intellectuals in Samogitia travel through its cities, establishing unions and clubs to promote what they dub as “The Lithuanian Revival”, in the Grand Duchy.\n\nThe Ruthenian Litvins of Lithuania have slowly grown in numbers and influence throughout the history of Poland-Lithuania, and now they hold a firm grasp on the Grand Duchy and dominate its aristocratic class. Now the two sides clash with each other, each with one uncompromising stance on what a Lithuanian is, unable to recognize each other’s culture and way of life as anything other than deviancy and distortion of their culture. Reconciliation seems impossible, and unfortunately due to our political position, intervention seems even less likely.
This used to be a whole lot more simple...

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is disintegrated, and now Russia has the opportunity to surge westwards against those who have spent the last centuries immiserating our people. We may decide the fate of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, the declining appendage that only managed to survive this far because of Warsaw.\n\nOur treaty with Scandinavia still stands, and we may curve the little Lithuanian state into pieces, Scandinavia will receive Samogitia, while we receive the rest. The sun sets one final time on Lithuania. From the west, Scandinavia is approaching to fulfil its Baltic dream of domination, and Lithuania is just another piece of that dream. On the east, the ever growing Russian empire is approaching with dreams of expansion in every cardinal direction. Now is the time to move on Lithuania, another patch of our imperial ambition. Russia is already prepared to take its end of the deal, now it’s only left for us to take Samogitia and put this ugly product of the Commonwealth to an end. Our marines are ready for the occupation, as we expect it to be nothing short than a short parade across the countryside.

A surprising turn of events unfolds in Lithuania, as one final piece of the country refused to turn over and die. A group of officers have come together in Vilnius to declare open resistance against our partition. Declaring that the Lithuanian dream will not be snuffed out. We are now in an awkward situation, as both us and our co-partitioner are ready to pounce on Vilnius, a valuable region and city that is definitely worth a little bloodshed over. But only one of us could hope to seize it!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us, promising us an alliance against Scandinavain aggression. We naturally know the true nature of this envoy: the end of Lithuanian independence. Flanked on both sides by aggressive powers, we have no way of resisting $FROMCOUNTRY$’s sly plot. Some to our dismay even argue that this outcome is preferable, as otherwise we will surely be devoured by both the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ and the Scandinavian beasts. But regardless of the lesser evil, this is surely a sad day for Lithuania...

To our surprise, the Russians have advanced on Lithuania, despite our ambition in the region. Our government will not let this act of Russian aggression stand. Our forces are preparing to set out to punish Russia for its treachery and retrieve what’s rightfully ours! And This time, we’ll take far more than Samogitia! Our diplomats are ready to hand Russia our formal declaration of war.

We have crushed Scandinavia feeble attempt to grab what’s ours! The whole of Lithuania is now under Russian control, and our hold over the Baltic is stronger than ever. Now that Scandinavia has been dealt with, there is no need to keep up the illusion of Russian protection over the little Baltic state. Lithuania will be annexed into our empire.

We have crushed Russia’s forces, proving that their only way of challenging our might is through treachery. The whole of Lithuania is now under Scandinavian control, and our hold over the Baltic sea is stronger than ever. Scandinavia now stands ascendant in eastern Europe, and any Polish, or Russian attempt to challenge our presence will be dealt with a severe hand.

Upon seizing Lithuania for ourselves, we expected at least some form of Scandinavian resistance. To our surprise, Scandinavia has run with its tails between its legs, leaving us with the whole of Lithuania in our hands. There’s no point in continuing this Lithuanian charade after the threat of Scandinavia has evaporated, we may fully annex this little puppet into our state!

Our diplomats are ready to contact Lithuania and offer it our protection. With this move, Lithuania will be made into a puppet state. As we are well aware, Lithuania is in no state to refuse our demands. Our top priority now should be to expect Scandinavia’s response rather than Lithuania’s.

With the collapse of the Lithuanian State, our diplomats have been proposing a union with the newly formed state of Belarus for the intended purpose of unifying the Ruthenians against any major threat to the east or west. $COUNTRY$ of course will naturally lead this union so there is no reason not to attempt such a union, at least if it occurs without the denial of Belarus.

The Belarusian and Malorussian governments have come to a agreement in regards to the creation of a confederation between both Malorussia and Belarus in perpetuity, with the intent to defend the interests of both states against both Russian and Polish aggression. There have also been additional talks in regards to the creation of a greater Ruthenian state that could be created if this union between brothers covered all Ruthenian lands but that may only remain theoretical for now.

The Belarusian government has disagreed with the sentiments of the Malorussian government in regards to the creation of a unified Ruthenian state. The only way that the Ruthenian peoples could be unified now is by the sword.

King Stanislaw Habsburski has established a royal dictatorship with the support of the army, constitutional reformists, and the urban bourgeoisie. This coalition is the Commonwealth’s best hope of rebirth into a true great power - so we had better guard it well.

We have granted the Ruthenians the maximum amount of internal autonomy possible without revising the Union of Lublin, which has managed to both anger Polish and Lithuanian nationalists and still leave the Ruthenians unsatisfied.

Stanislaw’s reign continues for one reason : the common people believe that his ends justify his means. For now, they will follow him and lend their strength to his endeavors, but if he ever loses the faith of the people, then his reign could end in the blink of an eye.

Our anti-Jewish policies have fostered considerable anger towards the government from the Jewish population, especially the liberal Jewish intellectuals who had previously been some of our strongest supporters. This has greatly weakened the liberal faction of constitutional reformists.

Smolensk, the gateway between central Russia and Lithuania, has been coveted by Polish and Lithuanian kings for generations, always a battleground between us and the Russian princes. The Principality arose in 1612 from the Treaty of Warsaw, when the Bohemian Kings imposed a Jagiellon over the territories which had rebelled alongside the rest of Central Russia, but which Poland had managed to reconquer in exchange for the Jagiellons forsaking their claims to the Polish-Lithuanian Crown. For 200 years, the principality has stood against all odds, but this ended with the revolution of 1839. Now that Muscovy has been shattered, Smolensk is ripe for the taking. We will not make the same mistakes as past rulers who sought to bind Smolensk with loose arrangements of vassalage. They must become our new northeastern frontier!

The Lithuanian magnates reacted poorly to our reforms, failing to understand that such measures were necessary for the salvation of the Commonwealth. For a time it seemed as though they would secede entirely and cause the union’s collapse. Fortunately, cooler heads prevailed, but they will not return to the fold through persuasion alone. Let us embark on a campaign of pressuring Lithuanian magnates to sell off their estates to us in order to deprive them of their influence - most of their lands are already insolvent anyway, and we will be paying a higher price than they would normally obtain for them. This will not be cheap, but it will allow us to draw Lithuania back into our union.
Prevent a General Rada of the Rus’

Our infiltrators within the Ruthenian nationalists have informed us that a massive convention of Ruthenian intellectuals, nobles, and militia leaders is being planned in Kijów. The scale of this endeavor is such that even if we swoop in on the organizers in the city proper, they will simply relocate. We cannot allow Ruthenian nationalism to boil over! They could ignite a rebellion which would tear the Commonwealth apart. We must avert a Ruthenian revolution, by any means necessary.
Seek a Path to the Sea

The Commonwealth cannot survive as an independent power without a major port. While Gdansk has for centuries fulfilled this role, we may wish to consider alternatives. Scandinavia’s influence in this city has given them undue power over our economy, and thus a different port could free us of this danger - unless we attack the Nordic Tiger head on. One way or another, the Commonwealth’s navy must sail once again!

A complete legal overhaul of the Commonwealth is currently beyond our power. However, we can impose limited reforms through the royal dictatorship. This provisional constitution will protect freedom of assembly, freedom of speech, and freedom of the press, while eliminating Polish literacy tests for voting and mandating that all ballots be private. We will also appoint Józef Skrzetuski, leader of the liberals, as Chancellor. This is a desperate act, but change must begin somewhere.

All of our exertions are towards one aim : a new iteration of the treaty which formed the Commonwealth, the Union of Lublin. This “Union of Warsaw” will create a modern government out of our medieval institutions, and what is more, will finally break the power of the szlachta and unify Poland and Lithuania into a single state. When that glorious day arrives, we shall be transformed into a true great power - and we will at last possess the power and solid political footing to shape eastern Europe in our image. §BThe urban bourgeoisie, especially the Jews, want a liberal constitution : the monarchists want a conservative one : the military wants an even more conservative one. Whichever groups we purge or support will influence the document.§

Our nation has come under the influence of reactionary elements who support a nation built by and for the Polish people. We must enshrine our values within a new constitution, to ensure their permanence even if our political enemies gain control of the country in the future.

Our nation has come under the influence of radical elements who seek a new, vibrant order for the Polish people. We must enshrine our values within a new constitution, to ensure their permanence even if our political enemies gain control of the country in the future.
Support a General Rada of the Rus’

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is struggling to contain its restive Ruthenian population. So far, they have bent over backwards to appease the Ruthenians and avert a rebellion. Yet a Commonwealth in chaos would be a great opportunity for us. Thankfully some Ruthenian nationalists have already reached out to us for aid. If we furnish them with enough resources - including weapons - then they should be able to agitate the Commonwealth’s eastern lands into revolution.

The Tatars have been our enemy for hundreds, even thousands of years! Since the first Turkic steppe warriors encountered our people, we have known nothing but hostility. Their cruelty and penchant for slavery and destruction are legendary. Now they have assembled into a great confederation which they think will give them the power to oppress the Slavs of Europe forever. They could not be more wrong! The Commonwealth is stronger than she once was, and now, we shall strike the Tatar menace dead, and avenge all those who have been lost to the tyrants of the steppe!

The Cossacks of the steppe are an unruly people who look down on civilized life. They have vexed us for decades upon decades, resisting any attempt by Warsaw to impose order upon the Wild Fields. While in the past they were a useful if untrustworthy safeguard against the Tatars, now they must accept their place within modern Europe. The Cossacks’ refusal to end their raiding and their scorning of conventional manners and governance leaves us with no option but to bring civilization to them by force.

Sloboda Ukraine has always existed at the crossroads of Russian and Ruthenian culture, creating a people that are not quite either. Yet their history of siding against the Commonwealth makes them a threat to our control of the steppe. We must subjugate them.

The Zaporozhian Cossack Host was useful in the past as a buffer against the Tatars and their Turkish sponsors. Now, however, they represent an obstacle to our control of the Black Sea. We must subjugate them.

Loathe as we are to admit it, the Crimean Tatars have occasionally been a useful counterweight against both Cossack rebellions and other threats to the Commonwealth. For most of their existence, however, they have been a menace to Christendom, sowing terror and destruction across the steppe. We must put an end to them.

The Don Cossack Host is located in a strategically critical position on the Black Sea, controlling both the Sea of Azow and the paths into the Caucasus and the edge of Asia. Furthermore, we have reason to believe that their lands are rich in minerals. We must subjugate them.

The Donets Cossack Host controls the pathways into the Wild Fields, and thus the eastern frontier of the Commonwealth. In addition, our geologists believe that their lands hold vast untapped reserves of coal and iron. We must subjugate them.

The Akhtuba Cossack Host is famous for their brutal struggles against the Tatars, arresting further Muslim incursions into the west. For that we praise them. Yet their resolve could easily be turned against us if they were to seek the liberation of the Wild Fields, and this is no idle danger, as their leaders are known to be territorially ambitious. We must subjugate them.

The Astrakhan Khanate is the beating heart of the Tatar economic system, the epicenter of the steppe slave trade. Their control of the mouth of the Volga grants them both wealth and power over those downstream. Our frontiers will never be truly safe unless we shatter this last bastion of Tatar power.
Now that we have conquered Sloboda Ukraine, we must establish a colonial voivodeship to prepare the land for integration into the Commonwealth.
Now that we have conquered the Zaporozhian Host, we must establish a colonial voivodeship to prepare the land for integration into the Commonwealth.
Now that we have conquered the Don Host, we must establish a colonial voivodeship to prepare the land for integration into the Commonwealth.
Now that we have conquered the Donets Host, we must establish a colonial voivodeship to prepare the land for integration into the Commonwealth.

Our conquest of Akhtuba and Astrakhan presents a problem. These areas lie at the absolute limit of our frontiers, and are densely populated. We cannot establish a traditional colonial system there. Instead we will form a Slavic-led confederation under Commonwealth military control, which will force the local Cossacks and Tatars to adopt sedentarism in preparation for their integration.

Our centuries of struggle against the Tatars are over! We have at long last broken their power forever and relegated the once-infamous scourges of the steppe to a conquered people. But the Tatars are cunning and persistent, so we must not allow any possibility of their resurrection. We will establish military settlements across the Crimean peninsula centered on the city known to the Tatars as Aqyar, which shall be granted a more fitting name. With this, our control of the Black Sea will become unassailable - and the Tatars will never again threaten us.

Pan-Russian nationalism will remain an eternal threat to the Commonwealth unless it is somehow addressed. The Foreign Ministry suggests that we give the Russians what they want…in a way. We have located a sufficient number of Russians who would be willing to form a united Russian state under our control, with the center of its administration in Moscow. Our military will need to keep watch on this client state, for its vast population will make rebellion an ever-present threat, but so long as we are vigilant, this should contain pan-Russian nationalism.
Press the Lyapunov Claim to Muscovy

The Lyapunovs of Moscow have attempted to unify central Russia under their banner before, to the point that the region is often known to Europeans simply as Muscovy. In more recent times, the Lyapunovs married into the House of Habsburg. Let us make them an offer : we will help them chase their dream of ruling Muscovy....if they submit to our control and waive any claim to Smolensk. Surely the Lyapunovs, infamously power-hungary even by the standards of central Russian princes, will not turn down the proposal.

King Stanislaw’s reign has not been fruitful. The magnates, not just in Poland proper but in the outlying regions which supposedly pay him homage, continue to conspire against the throne. If the King is to bring about his vision of a united Commonwealth, ready to face the future, then he can no longer be bound by the odious “Golden Liberties.” He is mindful that many junior officers within the Polish military as well as the urban bourgeoisie loathe the szlachta and their entrenched privileges. Some of the more paranoid nobles have spread rumors that the Sejm of 1845 is a trap, and that Stanislaw will, upon its opening, launch a military coup d’etat in the name of crushing plots against the Crown, and lay the groundwork for a permanent, parliamentary Sejm based on a modern constitution instead of medieval documents. If so, then the lands beyond the Polish heartland will surely look to outside powers to protect them from the King’s ambitions. Are the rumors true?
”Officers, seize these traitors in the name of the Crown!”
We must bide our time and endure.

The first casualty of Stanislaw’s assumption of dictatorial authority was Prussia. Ever since the first Prussian Homage of 1525 which transformed the old Order State of the Teutonic Knights into the Duchy of Prussia as a Polish vassal, some have seen this arrangement as the equivalent of clutching a viper to our breast. Those fears have been borne out, as the Prussian Balters, steeped in feudalism, are terrified at Stanislaw’s assault upon noble privilege. Thus they have sought Scandinavia’s protection against us, and Copenhagen has obliged, proclaiming Prussia’s annexation! Scandinavian troops have been welcomed with open arms by the Balters, and Scandinavia, keen to dominate the Baltic, will surely not stop at annexing Ducal Prussia…
We should have destroyed them when we had the chance!

The first casualty of Stanislaw’s assumption of dictatorial authority was Prussia. Ever since the first Prussian Homage of 1525 which transformed the old Order State of the Teutonic Knights into the Duchy of Prussia as a Polish vassal, there have been those who saw the arrangement as the equivalent of clutching a viper to our breast. Those fears have been borne out, as the Prussian Balters, steeped in feudalism, are terrified at Stanislaw’s assault upon noble privilege. Thus, in an ostentatious ceremony in Konigsberg, Duke of Prussia Ruprecht II von Wettin has declared Prussia’s independence! All forces of the Commonwealth are being driven from the rebellious duchy, and while it is unlikely to survive on its own, it may have greater ambitions…
We should have destroyed them when we had the chance!

The szlachta of the Commonwealth are nothing if not persistent. After Stanislaw abruptly ended the Sejm of 1845 by arresting many of the nobles in attendance and declaring his intention to abolish the old laws in favor of primogeniture succession and a permanent, parliamentary Sejm, magnates from throughout the realm gathered at the fortress in Czestochowa, on the German border. There they have proclaimed Stanislaw’s actions to be illegal, and have formed a konfederacja (confederation), the type of military association which has periodically arisen throughout Polish history. This Czestochowa Confederation seeks the overthrow of King Stanislaw by any means necessary. The great nations of Europe have declared their support for the Confederation, condemning Stanislaw as a crazed radical. In the midst of this treason, the Uman Confederation has also broken ties with the Commonwealth, though they have not pledged support to the magnates.
The rats huddle together, and the vultures circle above.

The Polish magnates have reacted to Stanislaw establishing a royal dictatorship at the Sejm of 1846 by forming the Czestochowa Confederation and seeking Bohemia’s help in ousting Stanislaw. With war brewing, the Ruthenian nobles have convened their own rada and decided to declare neutrality in the conflict. We shall not aid any of Poland’s enemies, but neither shall we shed our blood for their cause.

As we had feared, the traitorous szlachta of the Czestochowa Confederation are seeking outside aid for their insurrection. We believe that Prague and Copenhagen are both considering intervention. The Czestochowa Confederation has likely promised them economic and even territorial concessions if they assist in ousting King Stanislaw. Yet there is hope. The Czestochowa Confederation is rumored to be rife with factionalism, with its nobles already falling into bickering with one another. It is likely that if we prolong the standoff with the Confederation for long enough then they will collapse in on themselves. The real danger is that foreign powers may preemptively intervene in their name. We must be cautious.
Their fall cannot come soon enough.
The Czestochowa Confederation Seeks Aid Against Poland

King Stanislaw of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has declared a royal dictatorship with the support of junior army officers and the urban bourgeoisie. His main aim is to destroy the power of the nobility and their “Golden Liberties”. In response, the magnates have declared his actions to be illegal and have banded together to form the Czestochowa Confederation, a military association aiming to overthrow Stanislaw. The Confederation has now appealed to Emperor Sigismund for assistance against the rogue king. Our representative in Poland, recently recalled, has warned us that the Czestochowa Confederation holds little actual strength, and that its nobles spend more time bickering with each other than making war plans. Chancellor von Schwartzenberg has for once been the voice of action, urging Sigismund to uphold the aristocratic order in Europe and put down the “liberal demagogue at the door.”
Of course we shall stand with these honorable men!
We are not in a position to participate in this feud.

The Czestochowa Confederation has secured the aid of the Jagiellons in their rebellion. We have received word of Emperor Sigismund’s soldiers clashing with Polish border guards across the western frontier. As we struggle to contain the treasonous szlachta, we must also strike down the German invaders as our ancestors have so many times before!

We have received welcome news from the west - Emperor Sigismund has declared that he will not offer any military support to the Czestochowa Confederation. The rebellious szlachta had staked high hopes upon German intervention, and must surely be distraught at this news. We must not lower our guard - we have reason to believe that the Scandinavians may still intervene in support of the Confederation. Yet the lack of German support has bolstered Stanislaw’s position amongst the common people, a development which may in turn hasten the collapse of the traitors’ designs.

King Stanislaw of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has declared a royal dictatorship with the support of junior army officers and the urban bourgeoisie. His main aim is to destroy the power of the nobility, who have long enjoyed unparalleled privileges. In response, the magnates have declared his actions to be illegal and have banded together to form the Czestochowa Confederation, a military association created to overthrow Stanislaw. While many have speculated that the Confederation would reach out to us for support, this has not in fact occurred. However, given the Commonwealth’s great weakness at this moment, we could use the chaos to seize Royal Prussia (including the port city of Danzig through which nearly all of the Commonwealth’s commerce flows) and the province of Klajpeda, both of which contain influential Balter populations in need of our…protection.
We must not leave the Balters helpless.

We had suspected that the Czestochowa Confederation would court Scandinavian intervention. Now Scandinavian forces, in the name of “protecting the Balter populations of Memelburg and Pomerelia,” have invaded Royal Prussia and coastal Lithuania! The Balters of both regions have reportedly welcomed them with open arms, though the peasants have already begun to resist the occupiers. Most painful of all has been the loss of Gdansk, our main trade port, without which our economy will suffer. Strangely, the Czestochowa Confederation has condemned Scandinavia’s actions, suggesting that Copenhagen did not in fact act alongside them. In any case, we cannot address this grave attack upon our sovereignty - for now.
We will deal with them in time…

The szlachta were traitors until the end. When it became clear that they could not challenge King Stanislaw, they fell into infighting. Our forces arrived to find them battling each other! After crushing them, our men brought their leaders to Warsaw, where they met Stanislaw, seated upon his throne. Each of them personally laid their battle standards before him. The king then exiled them all, forcing them to sign over their property to the Crown and warning the traitors that they would be executed if they ever returned. This has triggered a general purge of the Polish nobility, with estates across the kingdom seized for redistribution to the people. The Polish commoners, once outraged by Stanislaw’s royal dictatorship, have been wooed by this marvelous show of strength. The Uman Confederation remains estranged, something the King must change in order for his plans to come to fruition. If Stanislaw and his strange coalition of monarchists, junior military officers, and the Warsaw bourgeoisie can win the trust of the Lithuanians and the Ruthenians, then perhaps the Commonwealth will at last become a united nation.

The Constitutionalists have been defeated by the combined forces of the Magnates and foreign powers who were not content with a strong Commonwealth thriving and its people freed! The Rzeczpospolita has been torn apart, the king Stanislaw Habsburski exiled along with other great Liberal figures. Now the Jagiellons of Prague have annexed western Poland while putting a cadet of their family on the throne of 'Poland', the first in 300 years. Little Poland has been reorganized as the duchy of Galicia with its capital in Kraków, while the Baltic coast has also been taken from Poland with Lithuania now a Scandinavian puppet. The only winners of this terrible treaty are the Ruthenians who have been given most of their claims in exchange for staying out of the war.
This day will be known as a day of infamy for generations to come!

The curtailing of the Czestochowa Confederation has destroyed the szlachta’s power within Poland proper. However, Lithuania and Ruthenia remain contested. Serfdom is at the heart of the matter - the Lithuanian nobility is fiercely devoted to their estates, and emancipating the serfs would turn them against us. The Ruthenian nobility meanwhile is under threat. In the aftermath of the Confederation’s fall, Uman Confederation Voivode Wiktor Potocki was removed from power by a conspiracy of haydamaks, armed bands of commoners and landless nobles, which is now spreading into the Ruthenian lands of Poland and Lithuania. These groups demand the end of serfdom, cultural protections for Ruthenians, and most disturbingly of all, “redistribution” of Ruthenian Jewish wealth. We must find a way to unite the Commonwealth without sundering it instead. §RIf we press either the Lithuanians or the Ruthenians too far, then they may not only rebel against us, but enlist foreign aid in their rebellion.§
Stanislaw will lead us upon the narrow and righteous path to glory!

Perhaps no other institution is so hated by the ordinary people of the Commonwealth as is serfdom. The hatred of the Polish and Lithuanian nobility for their own subjects is infamous, to the point that some magnates believe themselves to be descended from the ancient Sarmatians as they cannot imagine being related to those they rule over! Needless to say, the Ruthenians have for many years sought an end to serfdom, with Haydamaks launching raids against nobles across the Ruthenian lands. King Stanislaw now has the power to abolish serfdom by royal decree, without exceptions, and without compensation to the nobles. This would of course outrage the remaining magnates of the east, especially in Lithuania, but Stanislaw’s advisors assure him that the abolition of serfdom is an absolute necessity for our nation’s future.
Announce to the people that the person subject to any lord is liberated!
Lithuania’s loyalty is more important than the Ruthenians.

Polish kings have tried to Catholicize the Ruthenians since before the personal union with Lithuania was ever formed, leading to the growth of the Uniates. This has enraged the Haydamaks, who loathe the encroachment of the Catholic Church, especially the Jesuits, who they see as conspiratorial villains. While religious freedom is in theory already guaranteed within the Commonwealth, creating firmer protections for Eastern Orthodox churches and halting Catholic missionary activity in the east would calm Ruthenian fears of Polonization. The only problem is that this would enrage Polish reactionaries, who would accuse Stanislaw of wavering in his commitment to the Catholic faith. §RYet ignoring the demands of the haydamaks could drive them into open rebellion if they feel their grievances will not be addressed.§
The Catholicization of the east must come to an end.
The Catholic Church is by definition universal, end of discussion!

The Commonwealth is renowned as one of the only safe havens for the Jews, besides certain cities like Salonica. Yet the Ruthenians are enormously suspicious of the Jews. This has intensified as the magnates have invited Jews to move to their estates, draining Jewish artisanal and merchant talents from urban areas to fuel noble wealth without reinvesting it into the community. The result has been the steady impoverishment of eastern towns as well as mounting hatred of Jews, whom Ruthenians have accused of stealing the people’s money through usury and other schemes. Haydamaks have begun to assault Jewish merchants to “find” the money which they allege was “stolen” from the Ruthenian people! Crown representatives have made contact with some of the most influential haydamak leaders, who have proposed the annulment of all debts held by Ruthenians to any Jewish lender. §RWe must remember that many of the influential liberals drafting the constitution are Jewish, and this “jubilee” would destroy our support amongst them.§
If it will quiet Ruthenian suspicions…
This is absurd! The Jews did not cause these problems!

The haydamaks have lost patience with Stanislaw and his refusal to accommodate their demands. All contact with Kijów has been lost, as border crossings from Poland and Lithuania into the Ruthenian lands have been blockaded by armed Ruthenian guards in patched-together uniforms. The Uman Confederation, so long a sword of Damocles above the Commonwealth, has finally fallen upon us. The growth of the haydamaks has made the Confederation stronger than ever before.. The only reason it has not burst into open rebellion is that the Ruthenians of the east and west have yet to agree upon a single leader or a coherent political vision. When they do so, however, there will be dire consequences for the Commonwealth.

After months upon months of negotiations with the most influential haydamak leaders, we have convinced the Ruthenians to reintegrate into the Commonwealth. Our reforms have allayed their fears of Polish supremacy and the nationalist hardliners amongst them have been pushed to the margins. To be sure, Ruthenian nationalism is a concept which will never truly fade, but the Ruthenian faith in the Commonwealth project has been rekindled. We can only hope that it is a sign of things to come.

We will never be truly sovereign without a major port of our own. Such a harbor is necessary both for economic and military reasons. Gdansk served this purpose for centuries, but its recent capture by Scandinavia has strangled our economy. There is an obvious attraction in liberating Gdansk, but it would mean fighting a great power, and our military may not be ready for such a confrontation. There is an alternative. Khadjibey, located on the Black Sea coast, possesses an excellent natural harbor - and was once known as Kotsiubijiv when it was first settled by Ruthenians in ages past. Whatever one calls it, the port may be a simpler target than Gdansk.
Gdansk was, is, and will be ours!
The Black Sea is where our gaze must turn.
The Wedding to the Baltic Sea

”As Venice so symbolizes its marriage with the Adriatic so we symbolize our marriage with our dear Baltic Sea.” - King Stanislaw, $YEAR$\n\nEarly this morning, King Stanislaw arrived at the new Gdansk railway station, where the Archbishop of Gdansk presented him with two platinum rings. The king mounted a white horse at the head of his personal uhlan guard, thronged by cheering crowds as he made his way to the seashore. The main point of the ceremony was marked by a Roman Catholic service, with a sermon told by Reverend Michal Pazdan. At its conclusion, the King cast one of the rings into the sea, the other being fitted onto a velvet glove bearing the Commonwealth’s coat of arms, to symbolize marriage between the ocean and the nation. The flag of the Navy was blessed, and then, to the salvo of 21 guns, it was raised on a mast by sailors Tadeusz Jaruzelski and Edward Baclawski.
The Wedding to the Black Sea

”As Venice so symbolizes its marriage with the Adriatic so we symbolize our marriage with our dear Black Sea.” - King Stanislaw, $YEAR$\n\nEarly this morning, King Stanislaw arrived at the new Stanislawów railway station, where the Archbishop of Stanislawów presented him with two platinum rings. The king mounted a white horse at the head of his personal uhlan guard, thronged by cheering crowds as he made his way to the seashore. The main point of the ceremony was marked by a Roman Catholic service, with a sermon told by Reverend Michal Pazdan. At its conclusion, the King cast one of the rings into the sea, the other being fitted onto a velvet glove bearing the Commonwealth’s coat of arms, to symbolize marriage between the ocean and the nation. The flag of the Navy was blessed, and then, to the salvo of 21 guns, it was raised on a mast by sailors Tadeusz Jaruzelski and Edward Baclawski.

King Stanislaw promised that the royal dictatorship would be ended once a new constitution had been finished, and now he has made good on his promise. This new constitution, known as the Union of Warsaw, has been signed and ratified by representatives from all of the provinces. This liberal document establishes significant civil rights, reduces the monarch to a ceremonial figure, and reinforces existing religious freedoms. The greatest change is its new federal system which has merged Poland and Lithuania into a single united nation, with each province granted its own legislature. Finally, the Sejm has been remodeled into a western European style parliament. The peoples of the Commonwealth, especially the Jews, have cheered the end of Polonization and the start of a truly multiethnic state. The ambitions of such a behemoth can only be guessed at, but all of Europe must now reckon with a Commonwealth reborn, a Commonwealth united and ready for anything.
Sit Trinitati gloria, laus, honor, iubilatio!

King Stanislaw promised that the royal dictatorship would be ended once a new constitution had been finished, and now he has made good on his promise. This new constitution, known as the Union of Warsaw, has been signed and ratified by representatives from all of the provinces. The document strikes a balance between old codes and liberal proposals, expanding civil rights while still maintaining local traditions. The greatest change is its new confederal system which has merged Poland and Lithuania into a single nation. Finally, a permanent confederated sejm has been established, which shall be in session for most of the year rather than only on occasion. The Commonwealth has been reforged into a truly multiethnic state, the great dream of its past sovereigns. The ambitions of such a behemoth can only be guessed at, but all of Europe must now reckon with a Commonwealth reborn, a Commonwealth united and ready for anything.
Morte præventi subita ad vitae potum redeunt!

King Stanislaw, hero of the Commonwealth, has realized his ambitions for the nation. Its new constitution, known as the Union of Warsaw, has been signed and ratified by representatives from all of the provinces. This document has established welfare and school systems, as well as ending child labor. Its new federal model has merged Poland and Lithuania into a single nation. Finally, the sejm, long derided by monarchists as an unsalvageable institution, has been abolished. In its place the constitution has ratified the royal dictatorship, vesting absolute power in the monarch, and replacing elective succession with primogeniture. The Commonwealth has been reforged into a truly multiethnic state, though only at the cost of ending any immediate hopes of democracy. All of Europe must now reckon with a Commonwealth reborn, a Commonwealth united and ready to manifest Stanislaw’s even grander dreams for the future.
Summi Regis magnalia laude frequenta vigili!

King Stanislaw’s royal dictatorship made him enemies even beyond the magnates. The government, being devoted to realizing his political projects, left many people dissatisfied. One such man was Gabriel Pieracki. Pieracki had been a painter before being drafted into the army, where he lost a hand and an eye during a bombardment. He appealed first for an extended pension, and second for a government job, as he could not find work. Denied both, he blamed Stanislaw for ruining his life. This vendetta climaxed when King Stanislaw inaugurated the opening of the Royal Warsaw Museum of Fine Arts, which had declined to exhibit Pieracki’s works. He slipped in and made his way to the main chamber, where Stanislaw was viewing Jan Lorentz’s newest painting, “The Prussian Homage.” Pieracki emerged from the crowd, drew forth his old service pistol, and shot the king dead! Stanislaw’s death leaves the constitution unfinished, and has ended any attempts to establish a controlled Sejm. Dark days are ahead.
A nation cast into darkness by a single disgruntled painter…!

”The Council of Lithuania, as the sole representative of the Lithuanian nation, in the name of reclaiming our national honor and justice, proclaims the restoration of the independent state of Lithuania, with Wilno as its capital, and declares the termination of all state ties which formerly bound this State to other nations….”\n\nThe Lithuanian magnates, with tacit support from Scandinavia, have made their move. Stanislaw’s death had left a power vacuum within which there was no chance to restrain the restive factions in the east. The nullification of the Union of Lublin will likely embolden the haydamaks of Ruthenia to take action as well. This may be the end of the Commonwealth.
No! Not now! There is so much left to do!
Committee for the Abolition of Serfdom

Liberal activists, once a rare breed within the Commonwealth, have grown in number as of late. The leading liberal grievance is serfdom, an old and much-loathed institution and the foundation of the szlachta’s power. Now a group in Warsaw has formed to agitate for its end. The Committee for the Abolition of Serfdom boasts a wide range of members, cutting across religious and cultural lines, though led by urban Polish intellectuals. King Stanislaw has expressed sympathy for the Committee’s goal, but has refused to offer open support for serfdom’s abolition. This leaves the monarchists and the liberals at loggerheads with one another - two groups which are ostensibly his allies. The longer that the Committee goes unheard, the more agitated its members will become.
These gentlemen must understand that things take time.

”Nie pozwalam! Nie pozwalam!”\n\n”I do not allow!” That horrid phrase has been grinding into Stanislaw’s mind with each sitting of the Sejm. It is the liberum veto, a parliamentary device by which any deputy can instantly end the current session and void any measures passed during it. With nearly five hundred deputies at each session, all of them keen to protect their privileges, the result has been Stanislaw struggling like Sisyphus against the collective inertia of the szlachta. In his private moments, the king is growing hateful of the magnates, of the so-called “Golden Liberties” which they cower behind to hide from even the shadow of reform. He knows many junior officers in the army are reformists like himself, and loathe their noble commanders for skimming their pay. Perhaps they would support a military coup d’etat to create a royal dictatorship - strictly in the interest of ushering in reform and breaking the szlachta’s power.
Caesarean solutions will only lead to Caesarean outcomes.
This farce must end. Order mass arrests of the szlachta!

The Ruthenians have for many years felt abused and neglected, both by the Poles and the Lithuanians. The Ruthenian lands have always been rowdy, but the rise of the Uman Confederation at the dawn of the century was a sharp escalation of this tendency. The continuing impoverishment of the eastern lands due to economic migrations to urban areas has given rise to a dangerous trend. Haydamaks, armed bands of commoners and landless nobles, are forming in the Ruthenian lands, emboldened by similar groups in the Uman Confederation. So far they have confined themselves to raiding noble estates, Jewish merchants, and Catholic priests, supposedly on behalf of “the people,” though most are just as likely to keep their loot.

The Ruthenian “national revival,” spurred by growing urbanization and literacy in the east, has led to a corresponding rise in Ruthenian nationalism. Communities across the southeast have begun to view their neighbors in a new light : as part of a single East Slavic nation, distinct from both Poland and Lithuania. This is a dangerous development : if the haydamaks become animated not by general economic grievance but by nationalist zeal, they could transform into a separatist army. The king’s advisors are urging him to establish an autonomous “Ruthenian Territory” which would in theory enlarge the Uman Confederation without actually shifting the Commonwealth’s administrative borders. Others warn that such measures would only delay the inevitable, and that we should instead prepare for a confrontation with the Ruthenians. §RAllowing the haydamaks to become radicalized through our inaction could very well make such views a self-fulfilling prophecy.§
We have other concerns than bandits.
Let us give the Ruthenians the figment of empowerment.

The Ruthenian “national revival,” spurred by growing urbanization and literacy in the east, has led to a corresponding rise in Ruthenian nationalism. Communities across the southeast have begun to view their neighbors in a new light : as part of a single East Slavic nation, distinct from both Poland and Lithuania. This is a dangerous development : if the haydamaks become animated not by general economic grievance but by nationalist zeal, they could transform into a separatist army. King Stanislaw views a confrontation as inevitable, despite the pleas of his advisors to offer concessions to the haydamaks to defuse their anger. §RWe must prepare for the Ruthenians to further escalate this situation.§
If they dare to challenge us then they will regret it.
The General Rada of the Rus in Kijów

Polish officials have made repeated forecasts that, if the haydamaks ever became organized under a single political leadership, then they would pose an existential threat to the Commonwealth. That fear has now become reality, as King Stanislaw’s refusal to address Ruthenian grievances has pushed them to the breaking point. The Society for Ruthenian Liberation, an underground group of liberal nationalists, has come out of the shadows, and has convinced the haydamak leaders to assemble at the Kijów Royal Gymnasium. There the intellectuals and the warlords formed an alliance, the All-Ruthenian National Congress. Volodymyr Doroshenko, scion of the family which led the Zaporozhian Sich (the last Ruthenian polity) until the late 18th century, has returned from his dynasty’s exile in Poland to be elected Hetman of the Congress’ armed forces. The Commonwealth now faces its darkest hour, as the haydamaks spread revolution across the Ruthenian lands. The loss of Ruthenia will surely invite all of its old foes to partake in the chaos…
The General Rada of the Rus in Kijów

Polish officials have made repeated forecasts that, if the haydamaks ever became organized under a single political leadership, then they would pose an existential threat to the Commonwealth. That fear has now become reality, as the government’s refusal to address Ruthenian grievances has pushed them to the breaking point. The Society for Ruthenian Liberation, an underground group of liberal nationalists, has come out of the shadows, and has convinced the haydamak leaders to assemble at the Kijów Royal Gymnasium. There the intellectuals and the warlords formed an alliance, the All-Ruthenian National Congress. Volodymyr Doroshenko, scion of the family which led the Zaporozhian Sich (the last Ruthenian polity) until the late 18th century, has returned from his dynasty’s exile in Poland to be elected Hetman of the Congress’ armed forces. The Commonwealth now faces its darkest hour, as the haydamaks spread revolution across the Ruthenian lands. The loss of Ruthenia will surely invite all of its old foes to partake in the chaos…
The General Rada of the Rus in Kyiv

The Poles and the Lithuanians have pushed us too far! We have fed and served them for centuries, yet have nothing but poverty to show for it. No longer! The haydamaks have risen up across the Ruthenian heartland to liberate our people, and the Society for Ruthenian Liberation has come forth to sound the call of freedom and coordinate a new government. Thus the two hands of Ruthenia, one of the artist, the other of the citizen-soldier, are clasped together in eternal brotherhood. At the formation of the new All-Ruthenian National Congress in the Kyiv Gymnasium, Volodymyr Doroshenko, eldest son of the family which once led the Zaporozhian Sich (the last true Ruthenian nation before its conquest by Ryazan and the Sloboda Ukrainians), has been elected Hetman of our armed forces. With the Cossacks, the peasantry, and even the urban workers all beneath the banner of a free Ruthenia, we shall stand tall against our old oppressors!
Our enemies shall vanish like dew in the sun!
The General Rada of the Rus in Kijów

A catastrophe has befallen Lithuania. Bands of armed Ruthenian rebels have risen up across the south, seizing the territory in the name of the “All-Ruthenian National Congress,” which seeks to establish an independent Ruthenian nation! The Grand Duchy cannot survive in its present state. We MUST reclaim the lands lost to the haydamaks, for if we do not, the future of our own nation is shrouded in darkness.
The thieves will not get away with this!

We knew that the rise of the Ruthenian separatists would be a grave danger to the Commonwealth, but we did not realize the true severity of the threat. Not just in Ruthenia, but in southern Lithuania and even in southern Poland, regional elites have repudiated their allegiance to the Commonwealth and thrown in with the rebels! Preposterous notions of “Halyczynian” and “Litvin” nationhood have infected these communities, outgrowths of the Ruthenian nationalist epidemic. Men of high and low birth have both been seduced by the traitors, and the Commonwealth is coming apart at the seams. If we do not put down this insurrection, and reunify our nation, then we will surely perish as a result of this disjunction.
A Coming Deluge in the Commonwealth

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is locked in a standoff with a Ruthenian nationalist insurrection in the east. If the Ruthenians prevail, it will likely lead to the collapse of the Commonwealth. Our interests in the Commonwealth’s Baltic territories, both in Prussia and in Lithuania, behoove us to consider intervention. We have reason to believe that other great powers are planning to intervene and seize part of the Commonwealth’s territory for themselves. Therefore we should ensure that we have a seat at the table when the time comes to arbitrate the future of its lands - unless we are not in a position to act, of course.
We must seize this opportunity to…help Ruthenia.
A Coming Deluge in the Commonwealth

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is locked in a standoff with a Ruthenian nationalist insurrection in the east, provoked by King Stanislaw von Habsburg’s autocracy. If the Ruthenians prevail, it will likely lead to the collapse of the Commonwealth. We have made contact with influential Polish elites in Poznan who have assured us that they will assist in creating a Polish client state should the Commonwealth dissolve. While the Commonwealth has long relied upon German support, Stanislaw’s ambitions make him too dangerous to tolerate. We have reason to believe that other great powers are planning to intervene and seize part of the Commonwealth’s territory for themselves. Therefore we must consider our approach to this situation - unless, of course, we are not in a position to act.
We must secure our eastern border.
A Coming Deluge in the Commonwealth

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is locked in a standoff with a Ruthenian nationalist insurrection in the east. If the Ruthenians prevail, it will likely lead to the collapse of the Commonwealth. We have made contact with influential Polish elites in Poznan who have assured us that they will assist in creating a Polish client state should the Commonwealth dissolve. On the other hand, the Commonwealth has long relied on German support to survive, and its collapse would only increase tensions in eastern Europe. We have reason to believe that other great powers are planning to intervene and seize part of the Commonwealth’s territory for themselves. Therefore we must consider our approach to this situation - unless we are not in a position to act, of course.
We cannot allow the Commonwealth to fall into chaos!
We must secure our eastern border.

”Ruthenian Nation! The bonds of ages have fallen. Freedom has come to all the oppressed people, to all the enslaved nations of the Commonwealth. The time has come for Your will and awakening to a new, free, creative life, after centuries of sleep. For the first time, Ruthenian Nation, you will be able to say for yourself who you are and how you want to live as a separate nation. From now on, in a friendly family of free peoples, you will begin to forge a better destiny for yourself with a powerful hand…Ruthenian Nation! Get organized! Only by uniting can you know your needs, resolutely declare them, and create a better destiny in your own Land. Peasants, workers, soldiers, townspeople, clergy and all Ruthenian intelligentsia! Before You is the path to a new life. Boldly, unanimously go on that great path in the name of your happiness and the happiness of future generations of the Mother of Ruthenia, create your new free life with a powerful hand.” - Declaration of Ruthenian Independence, Kyiv, $YEAR$
Glory to Ruthenia! Glory to Ruthenia!

”Other men are the carving knife and serving dish : we are the fish and the meat.” - Józef Brzezinski, Polish author\n\nThe Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has never lacked enemies. Now, all of its old foes have fallen upon it at once. The Ruthenian revolution and its newly-minted army led by Hetman Volodymyr Doroshenko has torn the nation apart. Across central Europe, neighboring realms have plunged their own knives into the Commonwealth’s back. Whether in the name of supporting the Ruthenians, safeguarding certain minorities, or simply to “restore stability to the continent,” they have invaded the Commonwealth from all directions. Not since the Great German War has a European state been under such a devastating assault on so many fronts. If the Commonwealth can survive such an onslaught - such a great deluge - then it will be forever remembered as a truly immortal nation. If it does not, then it shall be forgotten.
The Commonwealth is not yet lost!
The End of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth

The King of the Commonwealth, after learning of his armies’ latest defeat, summoned the most pro-war deputies of the Sejm for a private meeting at his fortified hunting lodge. Neither he nor his guests ever arrived. Where they went - whether they perished in a natural disaster or were assassinated by foreign agents - does not matter now. The Commonwealth is coming undone : it could not survive Ruthenia’s secession. German forces in Poznan have convened a rump Sejm that has abolished the Commonwealth and restored an independent Poland under German protection. The anti-Commonwealth coalition’s representatives are convening in Warsaw to allocate areas of occupation, and splinter states arising from the ambitions of local elites are already falling under their influence.\n\n§RThough she struggled and labored mightily, the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is now lost. Perhaps this time forever.§
There is nothing more to say.

”Whenever kingship approaches tyranny it is near its end, for by this it becomes ripe for division, change of dynasty, or total destruction…” - Nicole Oresme, ‘De Moneta’\n\nKing Stanislaw was mortal after all, unable to overcome either Ruthenia or its foreign allies. The war brought him only failure, and suffering for his people. This catastrophe could not be accepted by the common people, who, after learning of the Commonwealth’s surrender, stormed the Royal Castle in Warsaw. Stanislaw was dragged before a “people’s Sejm” in the city center, where the mob voted to condemn the king to death for his despotism, and mocked Stanislaw by asking if he intended to invoke the liberum veto. The king, defiant to the end, was then Damoclined. The military ended this anarchy, proclaiming a republic led by a retired general, who has negotiated with the coalition to draw up an eastern Europe without a Commonwealth - a Commonwealth which is now lost.
There is nothing more to say.

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth fought with everything she had, to the point of national exhaustion, and denied the enemy coalition total victory - but they won a victory nonetheless. With the Sejm threatening to oust the king, he was forced to turn to the military to preserve order. This has served the interests of the coalition, who agreed to allow a general purge of the Polish nobility and for its monarchy to continue if the king dissolved the Commonwealth itself. The Union of Lublin has been shattered, replaced with a new, centralized Poland, shorn of feudalism and fueled by Polish nationalism rather than any multicultural tendencies. Order in the east has collapsed as a result, as Ruthenian nationalists are joined by other groups aspiring to nationhood. The Commonwealth may have perished, but Poland is not yet lost.

Miraculous! No other word can describe the victory won by the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth over her myriad foes. It is a triumph without precedent. The armies of the Commonwealth have vanquished not only the Ruthenian rebels, but all of the foreign empires which dared to raise a hand against the sentinel of eastern Europe. King Stanislaw Habsburski played his new-found glory for all it was worth, demanding that the heads of state of all the defeated nations appear before him in person to sign the peace treaty. Any magnates who aided these enemies have been exiled, their estates seized by the Crown. For the first time in centuries, the Commonwealth breathes freely, safe in the knowledge of her power. If she maintains and multiplies this strength, she may yet grow to become an empire in her own right.
Long live the Commonwealth! Long live King Stanislaw!

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has defied death itself! To the shock of Europe, they have vanquished not only the Ruthenian rebellion but all of the foreign powers which sought to take advantage of their weakness. The resulting peace treaty has confirmed the sovereignty of the Commonwealth, and annulled any pretense of Ruthenian independence. It is a shocking development for a nation that, merely a few years ago, seemed on the verge of collapse. Where those in Lithuania once spoke of a separate destiny from Poland, there is now a renewed commitment to upholding the union - the ongoing hunts for partisans means that the Ruthenians are for now saying little. This victory has by no means transformed the Commonwealth into an empire overnight, but it may well have laid the foundation for its rebirth.
This is only the beginning of our resurrection!

The defeat of both the Ruthenian rebellion and its foreign backers has granted King Stanislaw Habsburski of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth invulnerable fame. This resounding victory has made it difficult to openly criticize the king and his supporters. In light of this, Stanislaw has forced the magnates into line. Some were forgiven in exchange for relinquishing most of their estates and swearing on pain of exile to never take up arms against the Crown. Others were not so fortunate, seized in the middle of the night and banished, their property forfeit. Stanislaw then compelled the surviving magnates to ratify a new constitution, the Union of Warsaw. This document merges Poland and Lithuania into a single nation, with democratic elections and an institutionalized Sejm. All of Europe must now reckon with a Commonwealth reborn, a Commonwealth united and ready for anything.
Ad locum sancti tumuli multi curantur languidi!

Our victory against the pro-Ruthenian coalition has breathed new life into Stanislaw’s regime. The purging of rebellious Ruthenian elites has quieted matters in the east, and several magnates of dubious loyalty have been arrested. However, the political situation remains too volatile to conduct an all-out struggle against the szlachta without igniting a civil war within the Polish heartland. We must instead make use of this renewal of our mandate to govern, and modernize the Commonwealth with as much speed as possible.
We will make the most of this.

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has defied death itself! To the shock of Europe, they have vanquished not only the Ruthenian rebellion but all of the foreign powers which sought to take advantage of their weakness. The resulting peace treaty has confirmed the sovereignty of the Commonwealth, and annulled any pretense of Ruthenian independence. It is a shocking development for a nation that, merely a few years ago, seemed on the verge of collapse. Where those in Lithuania once spoke of a separate destiny from Poland, there is now a renewed commitment to upholding the union - the ongoing hunts for partisans means that the Ruthenians are for now saying little. This victory has by no means transformed the Commonwealth into an empire overnight, but it may well have laid the foundation for its rebirth.
This is only the beginning of our resurrection!

The king had hoped to capitalize upon his wartime victory to build up his personal reputation. Alas, the people of the Commonwealth were not so forgiving. Our monarch is in truth not the most charismatic man, his talents more fitted to currying political favor amongst the elite rather than the middle or lower classes. There are even dark rumors that the king had contacted sympathetic German elites in the west to establish plans to keep his power should the Commonwealth have been destroyed. These allegations, though lacking hard evidence, still turned most of the Polish middle class against the monarch. The military ended the discussion when top officers met with the king last night and informed him that they could no longer guarantee his safety, not from revolutionaries or from the magnates. This morning the king announced his abdication, and the Sejm will soon be convened to elect a successor. The szlachta seem oddly fearful of this…
We can only hope that his replacement will be superior.
Ruthenian Magnates Demand a Third Kingdom

The Ruthenian nobility is no longer satisfied by our concessions. We have received a petition - or rather an ultimatum - signed by dozens of influential Ruthenian lords. It demands the immediate elevation of the Ruthenian domain to a true third kingdom within the Commonwealth, and full control of eastern Poland and Lithuania! The petition has further demanded that the Ruthenian magnates be allowed to elect their own king without Warsaw’s input, and that Eastern Orthodox Christianity be recognized as its official religion. All of this is of course unacceptable! It would destroy any possibility of uniting the Commonwealth. The king and his cabinet wasted no time in rejecting this impertinent nonsense. Yet the Ruthenians refused to back down, and have formed haydamaks, armed bands of commoners and minor nobles, in defiance of Warsaw. They may take drastic measures to advance their chauvinist goals, and we can only hope that they do not draw in foreign powers…

A petition had been drafted by a Rada of Ruthenian lords to demand the immediate elevation of the Ruthenian domain to a true third Kingdom within the Commonwealth. This is far from a novel idea, its foundations being centuries old, nor is it the first attempt. We thought it the height of generosity on part - after all, we only wanted a king for ourselves, and religious freedom. Yet Warsaw rejected the petition out of hand! Clearly their goals remain the Polonization of Ruthenia. Something must be done - something drastic, something to mobilize not merely the magnates of Ruthenia but the whole of its people.
We must act, for the sake of all Ruthenians.
The General Rada of the Rus in Kijów

Our rejection of the Ruthenian demand for a true “third kingdom” within the Commonwealth has pushed the easterners to the breaking point. The League of the Archangel Michael, a Ruthenian nationalist society named for the patron of Kijów, has come out of the shadows, and convened a conference of Ruthenian nobles, intellectuals, and haydamak hetmans at the Kijów Royal Gymnasium. There the participants joined forces and formed the All-Ruthenian National Congress. Volodymyr Doroshenko was elected Hetman of the Congress’ armed forces. The Commonwealth now faces its darkest hour, as Ruthenian militias spring up across the east and seize control of the autonomous government. The loss of Ruthenia will surely invite all of its old foes to partake in the chaos - most of all the Russian Bear in the east.
The General Rada of the Rus in Kyiv

The time has come! The false promises of the Poles and the Lithuanians no longer deceive the Ruthenian people. It is obvious now that they never had any intention of granting us equality within the Commonwealth. Now the League of the Archangel Michael, a Ruthenian nationalist society named for the patron of Kyiv, has come forth to sound the call of freedom. They first called a meeting of Ruthenian nobles, intellectuals, and haydamak hetmans at the Kijów Royal Gymnasium. The result has been the creation of the All-Ruthenian National Congress, with Volodymyr Doroshenko elected Hetman of the Congress’ armed forces. With the Cossack hosts, the peasantry, and even the urban workers all beneath the banner of a free Ruthenia, we shall stand tall against our old oppressors! Perhaps even Russia will aide us…
Our enemies shall vanish like dew in the sun!

An urgent message has been received from our embassy in the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. The gist of it is that a Ruthenian revolution has begun within its eastern lands. The popularity of this uprising is such that our ambassador suspects that the Commonwealth as a nation is not long for this world. The message also notes that the Germans and the Russians are both believed to be supporting the Ruthenian rebels. War is all but certain to break out across eastern Europe as a result. Thus our government has taken the preemptive step of withdrawing all but the most essential diplomatic personnel from the Commonwealth. Let us hope that this crisis can be turned to our advantage.
A Coming Deluge in the Commonwealth

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth is locked in a standoff with a Ruthenian nationalist insurrection in the east. If the Ruthenians prevail, it will likely lead to the collapse of the Commonwealth. Our interests in protecting the Ruthenians, our fellow Eastern Slavs, behoove us to consider intervention - especially since an isolated Ruthenia could be absorbed into our own nation in the future. We have reason to believe that other great powers are planning to intervene and seize part of the Commonwealth’s territory for themselves. Therefore we should ensure that we have a seat at the table when the time comes to arbitrate the future of its lands - unless we are not in a position to act, of course.

”Ruthenian Nation! The bonds of ages have fallen. Freedom has come to all the oppressed people, to all the enslaved nations of the Commonwealth. The time has come for Your will and awakening to a new, free, creative life, after centuries of sleep. For the first time, Ruthenian Nation, you will be able to say for yourself who you are and how you want to live as a separate nation. From now on, in a friendly family of free peoples, you will begin to forge a better destiny for yourself with a powerful hand…Ruthenian Nation! Get organized! Only by uniting can you know your needs, resolutely declare them, and create a better destiny in your own Land. Peasants, workers, soldiers, townspeople, clergy and all Ruthenian intelligentsia! Before You is the path to a new life. Boldly, unanimously go on that great path in the name of your happiness and the happiness of future generations of the Mother of Ruthenia, create your new free life with a powerful hand.” - Declaration of Ruthenian Independence, Kyiv, $YEAR$
Glory to Ruthenia! Glory to Ruthenia!

”Other men are the carving knife and serving dish : we are the fish and the meat.” - Józef Brzezinski, Polish author\n\nThe Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has never lacked enemies. Now, all of its old foes have fallen upon it at once. The Ruthenian revolution and its newly-minted army led by Hetman Volodymyr Doroshenko has torn the nation apart. Across eastern Europe, neighboring realms have plunged their own knives into the Commonwealth’s back. Whether in the name of supporting the Ruthenians, safeguarding certain minorities, or simply to “restore stability to the continent,” they have invaded the Commonwealth from all directions. Not since the Great German War has a European state been under such a devastating assault on so many fronts. If the Commonwealth can survive such an onslaught - such a great deluge - then it will be forever remembered as a truly immortal nation. If it does not, then it shall be forgotten.
The Commonwealth is not yet lost!

The anti-Commonwealth coalition has prevailed. All of the Ruthenian territories have either fallen to rebels or come under the sword of foreign invaders. Thus the conquerors convened a Sejm in Warsaw to decide its future. The resulting Treaty of Warsaw has dissolved the Commonwealth, as the Sejm has officially annulled the Act of the Union of Lublin. A new Polish Republic has been established, but with Russian and German officials attached to its ministries, many believe that its days as a sovereign state are numbered. As for the rest of the Commonwealth, all the lands beyond the new nation of Ruthenia - now enlarged with gains from Poland and Lithuania - have fallen into discord. The Grand Duchy of Lithuania has collapsed, and the Balters have exited into an uncertain future. The sole bright spot in this calamity has been the republic’s annulment of all noble privileges, and the establishment of an elected Sejm.
Poland is our only refuge now.

The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth has defied death itself! To the shock of Europe, they have vanquished not only the Ruthenian rebellion but all of the foreign powers which sought to take advantage of their weakness. The resulting peace treaty has confirmed the sovereignty of the Commonwealth, and annulled any pretense of Ruthenian independence beyond the old Uman Confederation. It is a shocking development for a nation that, merely a few years ago, seemed on the verge of collapse. Where those in Lithuania once spoke of a separate destiny from Poland, there is now a renewed commitment to upholding the union - the ongoing hunts for partisans means that the Ruthenians are for now saying little. This victory has by no means transformed the Commonwealth into an empire overnight, but it may well have laid the foundation for its rebirth.
This is only the beginning of our resurrection!

The king had hoped to capitalize upon his wartime victory to build up his personal reputation. Alas, the people of the Commonwealth were not so forgiving. Our monarch is in truth not the most charismatic man, his talents more fitted to currying political favor amongst the elite rather than the middle or lower classes. There are even dark rumors that the king had contacted sympathetic German elites in the west to establish plans to keep his power should the Commonwealth have been destroyed. These allegations, though lacking hard evidence, still turned most of the Polish middle class against the monarch. The military ended the discussion when top officers met with the king last night and informed him that they could no longer guarantee his safety, not from revolutionaries or from the magnates. This morning the king announced his abdication, and the Sejm will soon be convened to elect a successor. The szlachta seem oddly fearful of this…
We can only hope for a better replacement.

As per the terms agreed upon with the other coalition members after the defeat of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, we have laid claim to West Prussia. This region, also known as Royal Prussia or Pomerelia, is a vital geographical connection between Pomerania and East (or Ducal) Prussia. Unfortunately, while we established a collective agreement to our annexation of West Prussia itself, we were unable to obtain a similar mandate over Danzig. This city has been dominated by Scandinavian mercantile interests for generations, and serves as the economic lifeline for Poland. Thus the “Danzig Question” may complicate our annexation of West Prussia.
West Prussia is in safe hands.

Our annexation of Danzig opens up the potential to take control of Prussia as well. Danzig is not as vital to Prussia as it is to Poland, but it is still one of the key Balter economic centers. Thus we have the ability to issue an ultimatum to the Prussians to accept our “protection,” like the Balters of Livonia. If they refuse, we shall have no choice but to take control of Prussia in the name of national security.

$FROM_COUNTRY$ was not satisfied with annexing the city of Danzig. Now they have issued an ultimatum demanding that Prussia accept their “protection!” The terms of this arrangement would be enough to end our sovereignty and reduce us to one of their provinces. If we wish to remain independent, then we must wage our most desperate war yet to defend our freedom.
We must accept this fate. (GAME OVER)
